option.name: content
option.value:
It looks like there is an ImportError when trying to import the csrf_protect function from the flask_wtf.csrf module in forms.py. Specifically, this error message is saying that the csrf_protect function cannot be found in the flask_wtf.csrf module.
One possible solution could be to check that the flask_wtf module is installed and up-to-date in the virtual environment. If it is installed, try upgrading it to see if that resolves the issue. If the problem persists, it may be helpful to review the code in the forms.py file and ensure that it is correctly calling the csrf_protect function from the flask_wtf.csrf module.

option.name: content
option.value:
To upgrade the `flask_wtf` package, you can use pip, the package installer for Python. First, activate your virtual environment and then run the following command in your terminal:
``` pip install --upgrade flask-wtf ```
This command will upgrade the flask_wtf package to the latest version. If you want to upgrade to a specific version of Flask-WTF, you can specify the version number instead of using `--upgrade`. For example, to upgrade to version 0.15.1, run:
``` pip install flask-wtf==0.15.1 ```
After upgrading the package, check your code again to make sure that it is properly calling `csrf_protect` from the `flask_wtf.csrf` module.

option.name: content
option.value:
Upgrading the `flask_wtf` package may solve the `ImportError` that you mentioned in your previous message. When you upgrade the package, it installs the latest version of the package with all the necessary dependencies, which may include the missing `csrf_protect` function.
After upgrading the package, make sure to restart your Python instance or server, and then check your code again to verify that the issue has been resolved.

option.name: content
option.value: Great! Does the issue with the `ImportError` still occur? Or has it been resolved? If you are still experiencing the issue, please let me know and I will try to help you further.
